title: The Current: Summer 2023 | US EPA - U.S. EPA.gov
summary: The WaterSense program has achieved significant water savings since its inception in 2006, with consumers and businesses collectively saving over 7.5 trillion gallons of water. The program promotes water-efficient plumbing fixtures, irrigation products, and homes, contributing to energy savings, reduced greenhouse gas emissions, and lower water and energy bills for consumers. WaterSense partners with numerous organizations to educate and encourage water conservation, offering resources and events to help people make informed choices about water-saving products and practices.

title: International Code Council Releases 2021 International Water Conservation Code Provisions - Pro Builder
summary: The International Code Council has released the 2021 International Water Conservation Code Provisions (IWCCP) to help communities conserve water resources and promote sustainability in building design. This comprehensive resource includes provisions from other codes, such as the International Green Construction Code and the International Energy Conservation Code, and incorporates standards from various organizations, like ASHRAE and RESNET. The IWCCP aims to ensure the implementation of efficient water conservation systems in both residential and commercial buildings, achieving cost savings and contributing to a more sustainable future.

title: Annual Program Emphasizes Water Conservation - CleanLink
summary: The article highlights the global water crisis, with 771 million people lacking access to safe water and nearly a million deaths annually due to its lack. Waterless Co., a company promoting waterless urinals, participates in the 'Imagine a Day Without Water' initiative to raise awareness and inspire action on the issue. The company believes its waterless technology contributes to reducing water consumption and protecting the environment, while acknowledging that collective action and social change are crucial to address the crisis.

title: 2024 Will Be the Most Vegan Year Yet, According to These 2 Trend Predictors - VegNews

summary: The New American Home (TNAH) 2023 in Las Vegas showcases a range of sustainable building practices and technologies aimed at achieving high energy efficiency and a healthy indoor environment. title: Union Cabinet approves NPK fertiliser subsidy for Rabi season; inclusion of Jamrani Dam Multipurpose Proje - The Economic Times
summary: The Indian government approved a nutrient-based subsidy for fertilizers and announced the inclusion of the Jamrani Dam Multipurpose Project in Uttarakhand under the Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana (PMKSY). The Jamrani Dam project will cost ₹2,584 crore and is expected to irrigate over 57,000 hectares of land in Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh, generating hydropower and providing drinking water. The project aligns with the PMKSY's goal of enhancing irrigation access and water conservation practices.
